author: John Anderson
title: ‘The Rachel Divide’ Review: Racial Profiling
text:
Its title is a bit too clever, but “The Rachel Divide” takes a largely serious, respectful and dignified approach toward a subject many would say is undeserving: Rachel Dolezal, former president of the Spokane, Wash., chapter of the NAACP, who created a sensation in 2015—and a fleeting national moment of addlepated self-examination—when it was discovered she’d been passing for black.
Was she? Just passing? The central issue explored by director Laura Brownson—and the one that probably got her started up this sociological...
